comment: This is an absolute personal favorite of mine. The fact that it is distilled in the great Buckeye State makes it even more amazing. The whiskey is definitely a neat only for me, I think ice or water close of the flavor and shut it down. Straight up notes of wheat and sweet vanilla make this whiskey an easy drinker. Caramel and baking spices remind me of homemade cookies, which makes everything even better!

[9/26/14] So smooth. This is a craft bourbon made here in Columbus. Sweet wheat, with a bit of spice and salty, caramel apple - this is stereotypical fall in Ohio. Unfortunately it's just a bit too soft and mellow to give more than 3 stars. Absolutely love the place and the guys doing this work are going to turn out many great products.

Bold vanilla aroma with a touch of oak along with lingering sweet notes.  In first sip, rye spice upfront shifting quickly to vanilla pudding and definite brown sugar. Some spice lingers with a subtle grain-like presence that fades quickly.
This is really nice, but it would be so much better with a couple more years of barrel aging.
Fruity, sweet with a strong hint of vanilla. A lot of floral notes in the middle with a really smooth finish. [06/11/17]
didn't like. It's sharp at the front and just difficult to drink.
Worthy of the top shelf of most any personal collection

It smells (yellow cake batter, burnt sugar) better than it tastes ( underdeveloped and musty dry oak) I agree with Jon...more time. For as young as watershed is I think they did a decent job. but i put more faith in some of their other spirits (the gins). If you want to support local craft it is not a bad offering. Batch #62
3.5. Kidney colored urine, rye, all spice, cinnamon, spicy oak, harsh finish, nice burn.
Drinkable but not special... buttered popcorn but harsh caramel finish

Nose: Clean baby diaper (this scent was so distracting I couldnt pick up anything else, now that I think about it this could have been left over from the detergent the bar used)
Taste: Nothing exciting, leather and a little sweet. Not many nice strong flavors present
Finish: short and a bit sweet.

Because the off smell could be from residual detergent I'm unsure if this whiskey is really deserving of this score but I doubt it's worth another try. Every other bourbon we had (7 in total) didnt have any similar smells so I am thinking it was just the whiskey itself.
As a bourbon novice, I very much appreciated the sweet and vanilla notes, as I used Creme soda to cut it.
Odd musty taste.  Finished but didn’t enjoy.
Smooth and unique. Can definitely taste the dominant corn mash bill. Good bottle to have around for blind tastings
Unique corn whisky, not bad just different
good flavor, but not very complicated, short finish.
Alcohol and slight green apple nose. More and different flavors than expected, but still young and thin. Not offensive but not impressive either.
Nice smooth, little pepper, little honey
Terrible aroma - straight ethanol burn. Thin and watery. Super hot with no subtlety. Very little of the classic bourbon flavors I look for. This’ll be the new one for mixers.
Sweet vanilla and brown sugar. This was a store pick single barrel, barrel proof bottle.
Vanilla and caramel notes with oak predominant caramel finish
Although smooth, with rich notes of vanilla and oak this whiskey doesn't separate itself to make a lasting impression.
Reminds me of bird dog ... ehh

Nose is lemony, spicy, some mint. Very cool.
Taste has a bit of erasers and young, but opens up to caramel candy, some baking spice, butterscotch and lemon peels.
Finish is quick, no heat. Some vanilla pudding and mustiness lingers but the finish is the least impressive of the steps.
All and all good whiskey. Would like to try higher proof or more age.
Soft sweet to the taste initially, then a slight barrel taste to end it. Very warming when it hits.
Nice sweet nose, but tastes like grass and plants (more bitter than sweet to me). Good in cocktails, not a fan of it neat.
Sweet smooth bit of spicy aftertaste
Smooth, oily texture, very light vanilla aftertaste, butterscotch, not as sweet, not spicy, some Oak flavor
Smitty’s pick, SiB, 114 proof. Haven’t made up my mind yet. Will revisit.
Fruity nose. Slight heat. Clean finish. OITF dinner
